[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotingRecords()] [DoS] Can an attacker submit the same ID millions of times in input.Ids to cause excessive memory allocation when creating the VotingRecords response? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotingRecords()] [Memory Exhaustion] If input.Ids contains millions of entries and each VotingRecord is large, could this cause out-of-memory errors or exceed maximum message size limits? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedItems()] [Data Integrity] If the returned VotedItems contains thousands of entries in voted_item_vote_ids map, could this cause performance issues or exceed response size limits? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedItems()] [State Inconsistency] If a voter's VotedItems is being modified concurrently by Vote() or Withdraw() during this read, can inconsistent data be returned? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedItems()] [DoS] Can an attacker query addresses that have participated in thousands of voting items, causing excessive state reads and node resource consumption? (Medium)
